"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552de0f36368722bd21d1000#post_552de0f36368722bd21d1000

One tries and fails at sounding Italian, the other is talked by mexicans.

In all seriousness though, Portuguese uses more latin in their vocabulary than Spanish, the other differences involve ortography and different phonetic evolutions

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552de1936368723bb9aa2f00#post_552de1936368723bb9aa2f00
[bq="HJSDGCE"]Hey, umm...
Who's Monty from RoosterTeeth?[/bq]
Rest of RoosterTeeth crew, "What is it Monty?  I'm working"
Monty, "Hi working.  I'm dead"

Monty was the cgi director and such for both RWBY and RVB; he died from complications due to medicine.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552dda6b6368724a06a70500#post_552dda6b6368724a06a70500
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552dd5bd6368722bd2130100#post_552dd5bd6368722bd2130100
Hey I see where your coming from.

[spoiler]For starters if I could change into a fucking WOLF BEASTMAN at will I'd totally use both sides of both worlds. 

But the way I see it is unlike us who would more than likely gain abilities like that later in life they were kids, and they grew up seeing there abilities differently.

Where Yuki at first liked being a Wolf and a Human she grew up to kind of hate her powers thanks to hurting the one she loved.

Where as Ame grew up loving his powers by appreciating Nature and hanging out and being teached by his Sensei.

But hey its still possibly different for others.[/spoiler][/bq]
Yeah. I'm sure if you grew up with it it would be no thang
But still, it seems like if you just stuck to one it'd be like cutting off your leg or something.

One word: Cocainum


"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552de27163687272b3ac0900#post_552de27163687272b3ac0900

Ambos adjetivos no son necesariamente excluyentes. El mejor trabajo de un hombre no es simpre el más famoso.

Lovecraft por ejemplo. Chtulu es el más reconocido, pero en mi personal opinión, su mejor trabajo es "El Caso de Charles Dexter Ward"

(Donde sale nuestro señor y salvador Yog-Sothoth)
